_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Agri-Services - Chaffee

Location:    Hwy 77 N.  1980 Cummins, Chaffee, Mo. 63740

Contact:     Bruce Jansen

Phone:         573-887-3568





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Agri Service in Chaffee are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Scott County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of liquid and dry fertilizer and chemicals for direct application to field crops. The largest amount handled would be the unloading of a transport delivery truck holding approximately 50,000 pounds. 



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia regulations and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The facility will work to meet the newest codes as time and budgets will allow.



4. The Five-year Accident History



There has been no reported release or accidents in the past five years that have caused any injuries, deaths or damage either on the property or to the surrounding area.  



5. The Emergency Response Program.



    The facility has;



        a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 

                 1910.38;



        b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and 

                  community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III 

                 (EPCRA);



        c. Employees will n

ot respond to any release other than to activate an emergency 

           shut-off valve while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will

           be notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1, 2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals and will make the required upgrades needed.







    4/21/16
